meanings.definition: Flavonols: a type of antioxidant found in certain fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent1: Eating fruits rich in flavonols can help protect your body from harm.
meanings.sent2: The flavonols in apples give them their vibrant color and health benefits.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous orange tried to steal the flavonols from the apple orchard.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bouquet of flavonols, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: Picture your cells dancing happily thanks to the protective shield of flavonols.

meanings.definition: Flavonols: compounds that contribute to the color and flavor of plants.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful hues of flowers are often due to the presence of flavonols.
meanings.sent2: Chefs use various herbs rich in flavonols to enhance the taste of their dishes.
meanings.sent3: The garden whispered secrets of the flavonols that painted its petals.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with the same palette of flavonols found in nature.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a world where each color is a different flavor of flavonols.

meanings.definition: Flavonols: a group of polyphenolic compounds with potential health benefits.
meanings.sent1: Researchers are studying the effects of flavonols on heart health.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended a diet rich in flavonols for overall well-being.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power came from the magical flavonols he consumed.
meanings.sent4: Her energy surged like a wave of flavonols, boosting her vitality.
meanings.sent5: Visualize your body as a fortress, guarded by the mighty army of flavonols.
